definition: to tilt one's head back to see (sth)/to look up at
surname Yang
to face upward/to look up/to admire/to rely on
to look at/to regard/to inspect
old variant of 視|视[shi4]
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]

sentences.english: She smiled impishly and didn't look up.
He gazed straight up into the gray sky and knew that he was hungry.
sentences.chinese: 他仰视着灰色的天空，知道肚子饿了。

sentences.english: It is better to be looked over than overlooked.
sentences.chinese: 被人仰视总比被人看不起要强的多。

sentences.english: We gazed up at the cloudless blue sky, marvelling in the magnificence and beauty of it all.
sentences.chinese: 仰视蓝天，万里无云，恢宏的美景让我们慨叹万千。

sentences.english: If you look up at the next Full Moon, you can see her face for yourself.
sentences.chinese: 如果你仰视下一次的满月，你自己便可看见她的脸蛋。

definition: to look up at/to look up to sb hopefully
to overlook/to look down at
to kneel and bow with joined hands at forehead level/to worship
to admire/to revere/to look up to
set up on high (idiom); not in touch with reality/aloof and remote
to live high and look down (idiom)/to overlook/to tower above/to occupy the high ground/fig. arrogance based on one's social position
imposing/upright and tall/outstanding/gigantic in stature
to look disdainfully out of the corner of one's eye
to overlook/to look down from a height
too high to reach (idiom); eminent and unapproachable
to look straight at
to revere/to venerate/high esteem
to revere
to worship/adoration
to admire
to look at from close up/to watch intently
